conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container (D or E) it will flow into.
Liquid flows down from A, encounters a light blue baffle, and is directed downward.
Liquid flows down from B, encounters a black baffle, and is directed downward.
Liquid flows down from C, encounters a green baffle, and is directed downward.
Liquid from A flows past the light blue baffle and continues straight down into container D.
Liquid from B flows past the black baffle and continues straight down into container E.
Liquid from C flows past the green baffle and continues straight down into container E.
Container D receives liquid from A.
Container E receives liquid from B and C.
Final answer: Container D will receive liquid from A, and container E will receive liquid from B and C.
